feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 7:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Another Round of Snow Tonight Through Sunday Night... Much of the Eastern Interior will have 2 to 4 inches of snow tonight through Sunday night. Areas along the Alaska Range near Denali Park could have up to 6 inches of snow. Northeast winds gusting to 20 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow in many areas late tonight and Sunday. Passes and Highway Summits will

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 1:11PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Another Round of Snow This Afternoon through Sunday... Snow will continue developing over the Southern Interior through this evening, spreading north into the White Mountains tonight. General snow totals of around 2 to 4 inches are expected, with the higher amounts toward and in the Alaska Range and lower amounts for the Interior near Fairbanks. Blustery northeast winds will
entry.cap:areaDesc: Nenana; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued October 07 at 1:51PM CDT until October 08 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE REMAINDER OF SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY AFTERNOON... The combination of breezy post-frontal northwesterly winds, critically low humidities, and very dry fuels with ongoing drought conditions will make for dangerous fire weather conditions the remainder of Saturday afternoon. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 9:32PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY LIGHT FROST IN SHELTERED AREAS POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT... Partly cloudy skies and light winds will allow temperatures to fall into the middle and upper 30s tonight. These conditions may allow some patchy frost to form in sheltered and favored cold areas overnight.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 07 at 10:01PM EDT until October 08 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A low pressure system with deep moisture will bring a period of moderate to locally heavy rain to the region through tonight. Some localized flooding of urban, low lying, and poor drainage areas will be possible where the heaviest rainfall occurs. Isolated flash flooding is also possible should heavy rainfall rates occur. Fall leaf debris could exacerbate flooding issues if blocking storm

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 8:18PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Frost Late Tonight And Early Sunday Morning... Patchy frost will develop late tonight, especially in sheltered valleys, as low temperatures drop into the mid and upper 30s. While frost is not expected to be widespread, in areas that see frost, sensitive outdoor plants may be damaged or killed if left unprotected.
